intro: Corispermum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian corispermum, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or yellowish, and it produces small, dry fruits known as utricles. The plant is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
